text: Gregg Gillis, better known by his stage name Girl Talk, is an American musian who remixes music. Gillis, who lives in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, has released four LPs on Illegal Art and EPs on 333 and 12 Apostles record labels. He began making music while studying Biomedical Engineering at Case Western Reserve University. He specializes in mash-up style remixes, in which he uses often a dozen or more unauthorized samples from different songs to create a new song; The New York Times Magazine has called his music "a lawsuit waiting to happen." ==Awards== In 2007, Gillis was the winner of Wired Magazine's Rave Award. == Discography == ===Albums=== * Secret Diary CD (2002, Illegal Art) * Unstoppable CD (2004, Illegal Art) * Night Ripper CD (2006, Illegal Art) * Feed the Animals CD (2008, Illegal Art) ===EPs=== * Stop Cleveland Hate 12" (2004, 12 apostles) * Bone Hard Zaggin' 7" (2006, 333 recordings) ==References== Category:1981 births Category:Musicians from Pittsburgh Category:American electronic musicians Category:Living people
title: Gregg Gillis
